## ErrorX.from() method

Converts unknown input into an ErrorX instance with intelligent property extraction. Handles strings, regular Error objects, API response objects, and unknown values.

**Signature:**

```typescript
static from<TMetadata extends ErrorXMetadata = ErrorXMetadata>(error: ErrorX<TMetadata>): ErrorX<TMetadata>;
```

## Parameters

<table><thead><tr><th>

Parameter


</th><th>

Type


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

error


</td><td>

[ErrorX](./error-x.errorx.md)<!-- -->&lt;TMetadata&gt;


</td><td>

Value to convert to ErrorX


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

**Returns:**

[ErrorX](./error-x.errorx.md)<!-- -->&lt;TMetadata&gt;

ErrorX instance with extracted properties

## Example


```typescript
// Convert string error
const error1 = ErrorX.from('Something went wrong')

// Convert regular Error
const error2 = ErrorX.from(new Error('Database failed'))

// Convert API response object
const apiError = {
  message: 'User not found',
  code: 'USER_404',
  statusText: 'Not Found'
}
const error3 = ErrorX.from(apiError)
```
